intro: Corydalis curviflora var. minuticristata, commonly known as the dwarf crested corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers and leafy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few centimeters, making it a compact and ornamental species. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pink or violet, with a distinctive crest-like structure on the petals. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or woodland settings.
